isis.stitle: ALTERNATOR: DELCO-REMY 26-SI SERIES - TROUBLESHOOTING - RATED VOLTAGE

svcprocinfo.para: Preferably, alternator output should be checked at the "Rated Voltage" given in Table 1. However, it is permissible to check the output in amperes at any voltage within the "Operating Range" listed in the table, since the current output will be quite close to the value that would be obtained at "Rated Voltage." The voltage should never be allowed to rise above the Operating Range for any length of time.

svcsubproc.title: Table 1
svcsubproc.para: It should be noted that the voltage may be below the "Operating Range" if the batteries are in a low state of charge. However, as the batteries receive a charge, the voltage will rise to some value within the "Operating Range."
Trouble in the vehicle charging system will be indicated by one of two conditions:

item.para: Undercharged batteries are evidenced by low specific gravity readings and slow cranking.
Overcharged batteries are evidenced by excessive battery water usage.
These conditions can be caused by:

Since one or more of the batteries may have an internal defect, they must be checked to determine their condition. Refer to GROUP 08, BATTERY in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for battery test procedure.

Poor circuit connections in the charging system can cause an undercharged condition only. Carefully inspect all connections including grounds between the alternator and batteries for cleanliness and tightness. Insure that the battery terminals are clean and tight and that the batteries are dry and clean.
Accessories left on for an extended period.
Incorrect tension on the drive belt.
If the batteries and circuit connection checks are satisfactory, the alternator assembly can or may be tested on the vehicle.

svcsubproc.para: Connect the battery load tester to the alternator output terminal and ground, or battery leads (alternator preferred) ( Figure 4).

caution.para: Alternator output terminal is at battery voltage.

svcsubproc.title: Voltage Test

step1.para: Record voltage reading at battery load tester.

With all accessories and the carbon pile turned off, start engine and increase speed as required to obtain maximum voltage reading on the battery load tester. Voltage should be higher than reading in step 1 above, but below 15 volts. All 26-SI alternators are set at 14.2 volts. Turn off engine.
If voltage exceeds 15 volts, remove alternator for repair as covered under REPAIR PROCEDURES.

svcsubproc.para: If voltage does not exceed 15 volts, proceed as follows:

step1.para: Connect a voltmeter from the alternator output (BAT) terminal to battery positive terminal ( Figure 4) (you may need a jumper wire to extend your voltmeter leads).
Load charging system with carbon pile to obtain 100 amps of current. Record the positive (+) voltage reading on the voltmeter. Turn carbon pile off.

Connect voltmeter leads from the alternator case to battery negative ( Figure 4). Load charging system with carbon pile to obtain 100 amps of current. Record voltage drop in ground circuit between alternator housing and battery. Turn carbon pile off.

The total voltage drop in the two readings (steps 2 and 3) must be less than 1 volt. If the voltage difference between the two readings is greater than 1 volt, check system wiring and grounds. Repair as necessary. Rerun test steps 2 and 3 to verify system is repaired.

svcsubproc.title: Alternator Has No Voltage Output
svcsubproc.para: If the alternator does not have any voltage output, run the following test to determine if the regulator is functioning.

step1.para: Remove the rectifier plate cover (Item 2, Figure 10).
Connect a voltmeter to the alternator.
Start the engine and operate the alternator at idle. With a screwdriver or short clip lead, ground the field terminal illustrated in Figure 5.

If there is no voltage reading, replace the voltage regulator. The regulator can be replaced without removing the alternator from the vehicle. Refer to REGULATOR REPLACEMENT. If there is a voltage reading, the voltage regulator is okay. Remove the alternator and repair as covered under REPAIR PROCEDURES.

step2.para: With engine running at a moderate speed (rpm), turn carbon pile on and adjust to obtain maximum amperage output without allowing voltage on the battery load tester voltmeter to drop below 13 volts. Record maximum ampere output on battery load tester ammeter.

important.para: Initial voltage buildup is by residual magnetism in rotor. Increase the speed as required to obtain maximum current output.

step2.para: If ampere output is not within 15 amperes of rated output as stamped on alternator frame, remove alternator for repair. If ampere output is within 15 amperes of rated output as stamped on alternator frame, alternator is not defective.
